description: From (a reordering of) the initial letters of proteinaceous infectious particle. Coined by American neurologist Stanley B. Prusiner in 1982.

entries.meaning: (molecular biology) A self-propagating misfolded conformer of a protein that is responsible for a number of diseases that affect the brain and other neural tissue.
examples: Prions retain deep mysteries, the foremost of which is what on earth they exist for.

description: From Prion (former genus name), from Ancient Greek πρίων (príōn, “saw”).

entries.meaning: A petrel of the genus Pachyptila.
